channel.title: New build, problems and advice
channel.description:
So finally I upgraded from like last centuries technology.
So, specs: CPU: i7 960 'Bloomfield', Running @ stock speed. Cooler: Noctua NH-U12P RAM: Kingston HyperX TI XMP 6GB Kit(2Gx3) ddr3 1600 HD:WD 3.5" Black 2TB WD2002FAEX SATA3 7200rpm. GPU: Nvidia 9800GTX+ PCI-E 512mb.
Anywho, just playing WoW, my cpu 'idles' on about 50 degrees, at least I think it does. Mostly all the software I use for monitoring temps are false or they jump all over the place, so I have to quickly reboot and check the bios for temps. No idea what I should do about it. I doubt I screwed the mounting system up, or stuffed the paste up. Possible, but doubtful.
Apart from that, I'd just like some advice on what should I do to get the most performance out of it, or what is now bottlenecking me.

item.title: New build, problems and advice
item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:

[quote=“xcel bears, post:7, topic:395270”]@sppt
im guessing you’ve got an i7-920? just by the stock core clock, i usually run mine at 4.6-4.8 ghz
what cooler u runnin? i got a cooler master v10, works like a charm :D[/quote]
Corsair H50. I think I did something wrong with connecting it, or perhaps its due to it having only one out of two fans, and that’s why its quite hot.

Read full topic

item.title: New build, problems and advice
item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:

Greeny:

Hmm well Antec’s are pretty good for cooling usually so that’s not the reason for the slightly higher temp. Although these newer CPUs may run idle at 50, but even my laptop idles at 45.

My desktop idles at 40-45, but that’s prolly due to it running at 3.8GHz rather than 2.67GHz

Read full topic

item.title: New build, problems and advice
item.dc:creator: @zoss0 Zoss
item.description:
@zoss0 wrote:

HWmonitor throws wrong temps. Which is really annoying. I don’t want to keep resetting to bios just to check my cpu temp =
Surely my temp would be lower, I mean, with this massive ass heatsink and whatnot, it should idle alot cooler right? I mean I could probably get it lower if I stuck the stock fan and and ramped the RPM to max?

I’m using a 1920X1080 reso lol.
Seems fine on WoW though, getting 60+ fps mostly.

Case…Antec Dark Fleet DF-10
I’m planning to get a ATI Radeon 6950, for next GPU. Don’t have the cash on me now but I guess it would compliment my rig fine?
Monitor is just a Acer x233H, using DVI.

Read full topic

item.title: New build, problems and advice
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

the CPU is fine temps, a little higher than it should, but completely fine. a little more graphics card power would help, right now the bottleneck is on your GPU. what monitor? cause 512mb vram is barely enough to push pixels across 1600x900 resolution, so lets hope your not on a 1080p monitor.

make sure you got your motherboard/chipset drivers installed, use HWMonitor to check the proper core temps.

Read full topic

item.title: New build, problems and advice
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

50s not too bad, case?

So finally I upgraded from like last centuries technology.

So, specs:

Anywho, just playing WoW, my cpu ‘idles’ on about 50 degrees, at least I think it does. Apart from that, I’d just like some advice on what should I do to get the most performance out of it, or what is now bottlenecking me.
